courses: Digital Image Processing and Robot Vision

work.name: Department of Robotics and Mechatronics Engineering, University of Dhaka
summary: Designed and implemented a novel architecture for BdSL translation, establishing the first benchmark in this low-resource language domain. Authored a manuscript detailing innovative methodology and findings, currently under review.

publications.name: Bornil : An open-source sign language data crowdsourcing platform for AI enabled dialect-agnostic communication
Classical machine learning approach for human activity recognition using location data
publications.publisher: UbiComp/ISWC '21 Adjunct: Adjunct Proceedings of the 2021 ACM International Joint Conference on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing and Proceedings of the 2021 ACM International Symposium on Wearable Computers

projects.name: Continuous Sign Language Translation
projects.summary: Developed SignFormer-GCN, a novel architecture combining transformer and STGCN to capture both high-level context and low-level spatial-temporal dependencies in sign language translation, integrating keypoint and RGB features to enhance recognition of body configurations and expressions, achieving competitive performance on RWTH-PHOENIX-2014T, How2Sign, and BornilDB v1.0 datasets.

projects.name: Comparative Analysis of Emotional Support Delivery by NAO Robot and Humans Across Varied Emotional States
projects.summary: Conducted a comparative analysis of emotional support delivery by NAO robot and humans across 3 emotional states, developing a system and questionnaire to quantify emotional impact, comfort levels, communication clarity, and overall satisfaction, with the goal of assessing the efficacy of robotic versus human emotional support and identifying areas for improvement.

projects.name: Automatic Stock Trading
projects.summary: Developed an automated stock trading system using approximate Q-learning to optimize buy, sell, and hold decisions for three Bangladeshi stocks, achieving an 11% return on investment and demonstrating the effectiveness of reinforcement learning in financial decision-making.

projects.name: Human Activity Recognition Using Location Data
projects.summary: Developed a classification model using location data with statistical feature extraction and a Random Forest classifier to identify 8 different activities and modes of locomotion, achieving a validation accuracy of 78.138% and a weighted F1 score of 78.28%, ranking 11th best result in the dataset.

awards.title: Honourable Mention, NASA Earth Observatory (EO) Dashboard Hackathon
awards.awarder: NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration), ESA (European Space Agency), and JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency)

volunteer.organization: IEEE Robotics and Automation Society, University of Dhaka Student Branch
volunteer.summary: Organized several workshops, interactive sessions and industry expert experience sharing sessions.
Conducted robotics workshops in multiple high schools and developed engaging quizzes for BdRO.
Designed and delivered lessons on classification algorithms and evaluation metrics for a group of 10 high school students, and created quizzes to assess their understanding.
